results.title: [The effects of treatment with atenolol and benazapril on 24-hour pressure variability].
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ induced a non-statistically significant decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure variability, whereas @CHEMICAL_benazepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044946 @@@benazepril@@@ caused a statistically significant increase in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@systolic blood@@@ pressure variability.

citations.NLM: Prattichizzo FA, Galetta F. [The effects of treatment with atenolol and benazapril on 24-hour pressure variability]. Minerva Cardioangiol. 1993 Dec;41(12):587-90. PMID: 8139779
citations.BibTeX: @article{8139779, title={[The effects of treatment with atenolol and benazapril on 24-hour pressure variability].}, author={Prattichizzo FA and Galetta F}, journal={Minerva Cardioangiol}, volume={41}, number={12}, pages={587-90}}

results.title: Effect of combination therapy with atenolol and the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor benazepril.
results.text_hl: We conclude that adding @CHEMICAL_benazepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044946 @@@benazepril@@@ to the regimen of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ whose @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure is inadequately controlled while receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ monotherapy can produce an additional decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure in almost half the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Bursztyn M, Gavras I, Gourley L, DeSilva J, Whalen J, Gavras H. Effect of combination therapy with atenolol and the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor benazepril. Clin Ther. 1994 May-Jun;16(3):429-36. PMID: 7923309
citations.BibTeX: @article{7923309, title={Effect of combination therapy with atenolol and the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor benazepril.}, author={Bursztyn M and Gavras I and Gourley L and DeSilva J and Whalen J and Gavras H}, journal={Clin Ther}, volume={16}, number={3}, pages={429-36}}

results.title: Hypotensive effect of the association atenolol-chlorthalidone in hypertensive diabetics.
results.text_hl: The authors conducted a clinical investigation in twenty-five @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ affected with essential @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ of mild or moderate grade associated with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type II diabetes mellitus@@@, the purpose being to assess the effect of 8 weeks of combined treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (100 mg) and @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ (25 mg) on arterial @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure, heart rate, and glycaemia.

citations.NLM: Gentile S, Coltorti M. Hypotensive effect of the association atenolol-chlorthalidone in hypertensive diabetics. J Int Med Res. 1984;12(5):281-5. PMID: 6500167
citations.BibTeX: @article{6500167, title={Hypotensive effect of the association atenolol-chlorthalidone in hypertensive diabetics.}, author={Gentile S and Coltorti M}, journal={J Int Med Res}, volume={12}, number={5}, pages={281-5}}

results.title: Comparison of nisoldipine and atenolol in the treatment of essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: These results indicate that both @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly suppress both plasma @GENE_REN @GENE_5972 @@@renin@@@ activity and the pressor response to stress leading to reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure.

citations.NLM: Takahashi H, Fukuyama M, Yoneda S, Okabayashi H, Yoshimura M. Comparison of nisoldipine and atenolol in the treatment of essential hypertension. Arzneimittelforschung. 1989 Mar;39(3):379-82. PMID: 2667523
citations.BibTeX: @article{2667523, title={Comparison of nisoldipine and atenolol in the treatment of essential hypertension.}, author={Takahashi H and Fukuyama M and Yoneda S and Okabayashi H and Yoshimura M}, journal={Arzneimittelforschung}, volume={39}, number={3}, pages={379-82}}

results.title: Changes in blood pressure and thermographic values resulting from use of a beta-blocker plus diuretic and of an alpha-beta-blocker plus diuretic.
results.text_hl: After one month of treatment, no changes in peripheral vascularization were observed in the group treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, except for 4 cases showing mild improvement, probably due to a reduction in peripheral resistance as a result of the treatment and to a consequent increase in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ flow in the area investigated.

citations.NLM: De Cesaris R, Grimaldi A, Balestrazzi M, Ranieri G, Chiarappa R, Avantaggiato F. Changes in blood pressure and thermographic values resulting from use of a beta-blocker plus diuretic and of an alpha-beta-blocker plus diuretic. Drugs Exp Clin Res. 1985;11(10):725-9. PMID: 3836858
citations.BibTeX: @article{3836858, title={Changes in blood pressure and thermographic values resulting from use of a beta-blocker plus diuretic and of an alpha-beta-blocker plus diuretic.}, author={De Cesaris R and Grimaldi A and Balestrazzi M and Ranieri G and Chiarappa R and Avantaggiato F}, journal={Drugs Exp Clin Res}, volume={11}, number={10}, pages={725-9}}

results.title: Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ effectively decrease @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure during a 24-h period.

citations.NLM: Graettinger WF, Lipson JL, Klein RC, Cheung DG, Weber MA. Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques. Chest. 1989 Jul;96(1):74-9. PMID: 2544352
citations.BibTeX: @article{2544352, title={Comparison of antihypertensive therapies by noninvasive techniques.}, author={Graettinger WF and Lipson JL and Klein RC and Cheung DG and Weber MA}, journal={Chest}, volume={96}, number={1}, pages={74-9}}

results.title: Effect of isradipine and atenolol on lung function in patients with mild essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: A significant @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@reduction of the arterial blood@@@ pressure was seen with both treatment regimens.

citations.NLM: Reiterer W, Meisner W. Effect of isradipine and atenolol on lung function in patients with mild essential hypertension. Am J Hypertens. 1991 Feb;4(2 Pt 2):197S-199S. PMID: 1827021
citations.BibTeX: @article{1827021, title={Effect of isradipine and atenolol on lung function in patients with mild essential hypertension.}, author={Reiterer W and Meisner W}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={4}, number={2 Pt 2}, pages={197S-199S}}

results.title: A dose-response study of oral atenolol administered once daily in patients with raised intra-ocular pressure.
results.text_hl: A fall in systemic @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure was also observed with the higher doses.

citations.NLM: Stenkula E, Wettrell K. A dose-response study of oral atenolol administered once daily in patients with raised intra-ocular pressure. Graefes Arch Clin Exp Ophthalmol. 1982;218(2):96-8. PMID: 7042481
citations.BibTeX: @article{7042481, title={A dose-response study of oral atenolol administered once daily in patients with raised intra-ocular pressure.}, author={Stenkula E and Wettrell K}, journal={Graefes Arch Clin Exp Ophthalmol}, volume={218}, number={2}, pages={96-8}}

results.title: Effect of Bisoprolol and Atenolol on Left Ventricular Mass in Patients with Essential Hypertension.
results.text_hl: Both drugs caused a @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@reduction in blood@@@ pressure, although @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ caused a significantly greater reduction than did @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in diastolic pressure (p < 0.05) and a trend toward a greater reduction in systolic pressure (p < 0.096) as measured by cuff.

citations.NLM: Weiss RJ, Rauscher A, Shaw D. Effect of Bisoprolol and Atenolol on Left Ventricular Mass in Patients with Essential Hypertension. Am J Ther. 1994 Jun;1(1):81-85. PMID: 11835071
citations.BibTeX: @article{11835071, title={Effect of Bisoprolol and Atenolol on Left Ventricular Mass in Patients with Essential Hypertension.}, author={Weiss RJ and Rauscher A and Shaw D}, journal={Am J Ther}, volume={1}, number={1}, pages={81-85}}

results.title: A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril.
results.text_hl: The results show that in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ whose @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressures are not controlled by the combination of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, the addition of @CHEMICAL_Bendroflumethiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001539 @@@bendrofluazide@@@ 5 mg once daily causes a significant fall in @<m>DISEASE_Hematologic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006402 @@@blood@@@ pressure compared with placebo and a significantly greater fall than 100 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ once daily.

citations.NLM: Antonios TF, Cappuccio FP, Markandu ND, Sagnella GA, MacGregor GA. A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril. Hypertension. 1996 Jun;27(6):1325-8. PMID: 8641743
citations.BibTeX: @article{8641743, title={A diuretic is more effective than a beta-blocker in hypertensive patients not controlled on amlodipine and lisinopril.}, author={Antonios TF and Cappuccio FP and Markandu ND and Sagnella GA and MacGregor GA}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={27}, number={6}, pages={1325-8}}
